interestingcomments.content:
Queries around strength of design for desks /!/ I am looking to build some new desks for my office and have got some lengths of counter tops. Have created a design to build legs for them but not sure if they will be strong enough and would appreciate if someone with a bit more experience could advise before I get supplies to build it.

Specs: Wood - CLS studwork timber 63 x 38mm Counter top 1 - 2000 x 600mm (40 - 45kg weight) Counter top 2 - L shape - 1500 x 600mm & 500 x 600mm (30 - 35kg & 5 - 10kg)

I have 3d printed one of the designs on a very small scale out of pla and tested its weight holding abilities but have my doubts that it will scale in the way I am thinking.

Any advice would be of great assistance.

Images:
Straight desk with no top
https://i.imgur.com/wYaevyk.jpg

L desk with no top
https://i.imgur.com/8ehh8yd.jpg

Straight desk with top
https://i.imgur.com/OPWTTyW.jpg

L desk with top
https://i.imgur.com/PoYvfE9.jpg

3d prints without weight then with weight (power tool battery)
https://i.imgur.com/UNnA78l.jpg https://i.imgur.com/X3VUzqu.jpg
